title: Connor Evan Gappmayer
content:
2005-2015
Our sweet, loving, son and brother, Connor Evan Gappmayer, returned to the loving arms of his Heavenly Father on Friday, December 4, 2015 due to an accidental shooting.
Connor was born to Roy H. and Sheri Stewart Gappmayer on July 17, 2005 in Payson, Utah. He lived in Lake Shore and was in the 5th grade at Brockbank Elementary School in Spanish Fork. He was an excellent student and especially enjoyed reading fantasy books. He also excelled in math and science.
Connor was a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. He was involved in cub scouting where he was currently in Webelos. He was also participating in a youth wrestling program. Connor loved to play video games with his family. With his contagious laugh and cheerful attitude, Connor had a special way of making other people feel happy. He was kind, caring, and helpful to everyone.
He is survived by his loving parents, Roy and Sheri, two older sisters, Cassady and Katelyn, and an older brother, Konlin, who is currently serving an LDS mission in Washington State. He is also survived by his grandparents, Leland Gappmayer and Evan and Valene Stewart, and many aunts, uncles, and cousins. Connor was preceded in death by his brother, Kade, and his grandmother, LaVern Gappmayer.
Funeral services will be held on Thursday, December 10, 2015 at 11:00 am in the Lake Shore LDS Chapel located at 5916 S. 3200 W. in Lake Shore. Friends and family may pay their respects at the church from 9:00 to 10:45 am. Interment will be in the Orem City Cemetery at 1520 N. 800 E., Orem, Utah. Condolences may be sent to the family at www.SundbergOlpinMortuary.com.
We Love and Miss you, Connor!
